intro: Salvia caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian sage, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually violet to purple, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the branches. Salvia caucasica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
